body: @danstowell your togo output looks correct (the documentation output uses a different config). For the uk example, your bounding box coordinates are flipped (should have longitude first per http://devseed.com/label-maker/parameters.html)

Thank you for spotting my error!
After fixing it, I still appear to get zero:

```
% label-maker download   
Saving QA tiles to data/united_kingdom.mbtiles
   100%      1.0 GiB     986.1 KiB/s            0:00:00 ETA    
% label-maker labels  
Determining labels for each tile
---
Roads: 0 tiles
photovoltaic: 0 tiles
Total tiles: 72
Writing out labels to data/labels.npz
```

(For completeness: my bbox is now specified as `  "bounding_box": [-0.440826416015625,51.31258868168418,0.23345947265625,51.68362528576683]`)

I note that this time I get 72 tiles rather than 54, so it's not reusing the stale data. (Is there any cache file one should delete before retrying? It definitely re-downloaded the QA tiles)

@danstowell yes, you'll need to remove `data/united_kingdom-z12.mbtiles` (and maybe `data/united_kingdom.geojson` to be safe) and run `label-maker labels` again. Note that this is only true for changes to the bounding box, you can make class changes without deleting these files.

Expected output should be:
```sh
Roads: 72 tiles
photovoltaic: 28 tiles
Total tiles: 72
Writing out labels to data/labels.npz
```

Let me know if that helps!
Got it, thanks. I now have the same output as you. Thanks for the patient answers

This error appears with me.
This my config.json:
```{
  "country": "russia",
  "bounding_box": [55.67794, 37.46674, 55.68805, 37.5451],
  "zoom": 17,
  "classes": [
    { "name": "Roads", "filter": ["has", "highway"] },
    { "name": "Buildings", "filter": ["has", "building"] }
  ],
  "imagery": "http://a.tiles.mapbox.com/v4/mapbox.satellite/{z}/{x}/{y}.jpg?access_token="
    + token,
  "background_ratio": 1,
  "ml_type": "classification"
}
```

I launched this bash-command:
```
dir_name = "moscow17"
!label-maker download --dest $dir_name --config config.json
!label-maker labels --dest $dir_name --config config.json
!label-maker preview -n 10 --dest $dir_name --config config.json
!label-maker images --dest $dir_name --config config.json
!label-maker package --dest $dir_name --config config.json
```
and got:
```
Saving QA tiles to moscow17/russia.mbtiles
   100%      5.5 GiB       3.5 MiB/s            0:00:00 ETA   
Retiling QA Tiles to zoom level 17 (takes a bit)
0 features, 10 bytes of geometry, 4 bytes of separate metadata, 0 bytes of string pool
Did not read any valid geometries
Determining labels for each tile
---
Roads: 0 features in 0 tiles
Buildings: 0 features in 0 tiles
Total tiles: 185
Writing out labels to moscow17/labels.npz
```
So, I tried the decision from @drewbo and deleted all files in directory except russia.mbtiles. I executed the code again and problem was not be solved.
So, what is the problem? I think config.json is correct, but maybe there is a mistake.

@NickElixir the bounding box has the longitude and latitude values switched (so the bounding box is located in Iraq instead of Russia). You can check parameter details here: http://devseed.com/label-maker/parameters.html

Thanks, @drewbo! It was a childish mistake, now it works.
But retiling takes really much time. Near 8 hours. Is this normal or not?

@NickElixir it really depends on the size of the bounding box and the density of the OSM data in that region. Unfortunately there isn't a perfect way to query OSM data for this project, in my understanding it's a tradeoff between two main options:
- [Overpass API](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Overpass_API) allows for arbitrary queries on OSM data but each hosted instance has rate limits which I'd worry about exceeding for large tasks.
- [OSM QA Tiles](https://osmlab.github.io/osm-qa-tiles/) have all the necessary data per country but require post-processing because they are made available at zoom level 12.

Ultimately we went with the second option. To get the tile data at the zoom requested by the user, we:
- convert the `mbtiles` file to GeoJSON using `tippecanoe-decode`
- filter that using the input bounding box to speed up the following step
- retile at the desired zoom level using `tippecanoe`

It's a bit of a hack and in my mind is the weakest part of the library. Let me know if this is helpful information and if you have any other ideas about how to implement.

So, the configuration is correct too. I tried to reset ...-z16.mbtiles and geojson, but it's not help. What can the problem be?

I found the problem: it was that I forget to copy "russia.mbtiles" to directory of Yakytsk Airport.
So, I have another question: how can I refer to "russia.mbtiles" which is located in parent directory for avoidance copying this file?

In this function I need to change only this code:
`mbtiles_file = op.join(dest_folder, '{}.mbtiles'.format(country))`
I don't need to import make_labels() function from library.
So, how can I edit library?
Can I use fork in GitHub and save label-maker CLI functionality or I can change label.py only on my computer for it?
@drewbo And thank you, using operator `==` is more effective
